publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4984 Frances Curran: Giveme5—That the Parliament supports the "giveme5" campaign, launched by The Richmond Fellowship and FOCUS to increase the permitted earnings disregard for people on means-tested benefits; notes that the permitted earnings disregard has not been increased for five years and supports the call for the Westminster Government to increase it by £5 per week to £25, and further notes that the permitted earnings disregard enables people to increase their skills and confidence in the knowledge that their benefits will not be affected and can be a stepping stone to future employment.
S2M-4984 Giveme5 (lodged on 23 October 2006) Campbell Martin*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-4984 Giveme5 (lodged on 23 October 2006) Des McNulty*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-4984 Giveme5 (lodged on 23 October 2006) Dr Jean Turner*

Supported by: Campbell Martin, Tommy Sheridan, Des McNulty, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Rosie Kane, Dr Jean Turner
S2M-4984 Giveme5 (lodged on 23 October 2006) Donald Gorrie*
